page.title: 04CROOME COURT
page.content: {Croome Court}dates from{1776. The building was designed by{Sanderson {Miller,}the interior by{Adam}and {Chippendale}and the gardens by {Capability Brown.}It was the seat of the{Earls of Coventry}until{1949.}It was the centre of a large self-sufficient estate which included gravel pits, lime pits and salt pans. To run the court required 60 outside and 60 inside staff. Distinguished visitors have included{Queen {Willhelmina of the Netherlands}and {King George V. Because of death duties the Coventry family sold the estate in{1949.}The estate was broken up and the court sold to the{Catholic Church}as an annexe to the nearby{Besford Court {Special School}(q.v.).
